newsArray.content: Ο ΠΑΣΠ ενημέρωσε για τα βραβεία για τα «PASP FOOTBALL AWARDS 2022/23». Αναλυτικά: Όσο πλησιάζουμε προς την ολοκλήρωση του πρωταθλήματος τόσο μεγαλώνει η αγωνία όσον αφορά τους πρωταγωνιστές που θα βραβευτούν στα ετήσια βραβεία του Παγκύπριου Συνδέσμου Ποδοσφαιριστών. Τα «PASP FOOTBALL AWARDS 2022/23», τα οποία έχουν καταστεί θεσμός στα ποδοσφαιρικά δρώμενα της Κύπρου, θα πραγματοποιηθούν τον προσεχή Μάιο και θα μεταδοθούν απευθείας από την Cablenet μέσω του καναλιού Cablenet Sports1HD. Η πρώτη διαδικασία ψηφοφορίας αρχίζει αύριο Τρίτη (28/03/2023) με τη ψηφοφορία για την ανάδειξη του καλύτερου γκολ και καλύτερης απόκρουσης από τη πρώτη φάση του πρωταθλήματος αλλά και του κορυφαίου νέου ποδοσφαιριστή. Ο ΠΑ.Σ.Π. προς ενημέρωση του κοινού ανακοινώνει σήμερα τις κατηγορίες βραβεύσεων και τις λεπτομέρειες σχετικά με τη διαδικασία της ανάδειξης των νικητών: Ο ΠΑ.Σ.Π. θα τιμήσει πρώην ποδοσφαιριστές και ποδοσφαιρίστριες για τη μεγάλη τους προσφορά στο κυπριακό ποδόσφαιρο και την Εθνική ομάδα. Oι 15 τερματοφύλακες που απέσπασαν το Stoiximan Top Save θα τεθούν σε τρεις διαφορετικές ψηφοφορίες: των φιλάθλων στην ιστοσελίδα του ΠΑ.Σ.Π., της ειδικής επιτροπής και των ίδιων των υποψήφιων ποδοσφαιριστών. Θα βραβευτούν οι τρεις κορυφαίες αποκρούσεις της πρώτης φάσης του πρωταθλήματος. Οι βραβεύσεις αφορούν τα τρία καλύτερα γκολ της πρώτης φάσης του πρωταθλήματος. Υποψήφιοι είναι οι 24 νικητές του Stoiximan Top Goal. Οι τρεις νικητές θα ανακηρυχθούν μετά από ψηφοφορία των φιλάθλων στην ιστοσελίδα του ΠΑ.Σ.Π., της ειδικής επιτροπής και των ίδιων των υποψήφιων ποδοσφαιριστών. Τα Χρυσά Γάντια θα λάβουν οι τερματοφύλακες με τα περισσότερα clean sheets σε πρώτο και σε δεύτερο γκρουπ αντίστοιχα. Για το μεγάλο βραβείο Stoiximan Golden Gloves συμπεριλαμβάνονται όλες οι αγωνιστικές της περιόδου. Πρόκειται για τους πρώτους σκόρερ του πρώτου και του δεύτερου γκρουπ στην Α’ Κατηγορία, του Πρωταθλήματος Νέων (U19) και του Γυναικείου Πρωταθλήματος. Θα βραβευτεί η κορυφαία ενδεκάδα όπως θα την επιλέξουν μέσα από εκλογική διαδικασία οι ίδιοι οι ποδοσφαιριστές των ομάδων της Α’ Κατηγορίας. Θα παρουσιαστεί η δεύτερη καλύτερη ενδεκάδα, με τους φιναλίστ ποδοσφαιριστές που έφθασαν ένα βήμα πριν την συμπερίληψή τους στην κορυφαία ενδεκάδα. Ο κορυφαίος προπονητής θα αναδειχθεί από την ψηφοφορία των ιδίων των ποδοσφαιριστών των ομάδων της Α’ Κατηγορίας. Υποψήφιοι για το υπό αναφορά βραβείο είναι οι πρώτοι δέκα ποδοσφαιριστές σε λεπτά συμμετοχής με την ολοκλήρωση της πρώτης φάσης του πρωταθλήματος. Σε αυτή την κατηγορία υπάρχει ηλικιακός περιορισμός. Συγκεκριμένα, οι ποδοσφαιριστές δεν έπρεπε να υπερβαίνουν το 21ο έτος της ηλικίας τους όταν ξεκινούσε η σεζόν. Ο νικητής θα καθοριστεί από τα ακόλουθα κριτήρια: Τις ψήφους των φιλάθλων στην ιστοσελίδα του ΠΑ.Σ.Π., της ειδικής επιτροπής και των ίδιων των υποψήφιων ποδοσφαιριστών. Ο κορυφαίος ποδοσφαιριστής της σεζόν αναδεικνύεται μέσα από την ψηφοφορία των ιδίων των ποδοσφαιριστών των ομάδων της Α’ Κατηγορίας, σε συνάρτηση με τον διεθνή δείκτη InStat index ο οποίος είναι αποτέλεσμα ενός αλγόριθμου με βάση όλες τις ενέργειες που κάνει ο κάθε παίκτης στο γήπεδο.

newsArray.title: Foot-CAN 2023 (Qualifications/4e journée): Le Niger affrontera l’Algérie au stade de Radès
creator: African Manager
newsArray.description: La sélection algérienne de football, arrivée dimanche à Tunis, a effectué la veille une séance d’entraînement nocturne sur la pelouse du stade Hamadi Agrebi de Radès.Les Fennecs, rappelle-t-ton, préparent leur confrontation avec le Niger ce lundi à Radès (17h), dans le cadre de la 4e journée (Groupe F) des éliminatoires de la coupe d’Afrique des […]
newsArray.content: La sélection algérienne de football, arrivée dimanche à Tunis, a effectué la veille une séance d’entraînement nocturne sur la pelouse du stade Hamadi Agrebi de Radès. Les Fennecs, rappelle-t-ton, préparent leur confrontation avec le Niger ce lundi à Radès (17h), dans le cadre de la 4e journée (Groupe F) des éliminatoires de la coupe d’Afrique des nations 2024. Le Niger, contraint de disputer ses matchs en dehors du stade de Niamey, non qualifié par la Confédération africaine de football (CAF) devra accueillir l’Algérie sur le sol tunisien. L’Algérie s’était imposé à l’aller 2-1. A noter que l’accès au stade sera gratuit pour les supporters des deux sélections.

newsArray.title: VIRGINIA TECH TESTS SAFR SPORTS PROTECH HELMET COVER, ORDERS 110 FOR FOOTBALL TEAM
newsArray.description: CHESTER SPRINGS, Pa., March 27, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- This past December, SAFR Sports teamed with Virginia Tech's Helmet Lab to test their latest ProTech helmet cover models on popular 5-Star football helmets. After more than 320 tests conducted over three days of research, the results...
newsArray.content: , /PRNewswire/ -- This past December, SAFR Sports teamed with Helmet Lab to test their latest ProTech helmet cover models on popular 5-Star football helmets. After more than 320 tests conducted over three days of research, the results were impressive – in fact, by adding a SAFR ProTech, the risk of concussion scores were reduced by as much as to 77%. Virgina Tech's Helmet Lab, considered the 'Good Housekeeping Seal of Approval' when it comes to helmet testing, has been providing consumers with unbiased information on helmet safety since 2011. The helmet star rating system is led by Dr. , who revolutionized the field of concussion biomechanics and head injury research. Once Dr. Duma saw the results of SAFR ProTech, he reached out to , Associate Athletic Director for Sports Medicine, and shared SAFR's technology and testing data. Committed to creating the safest environment for their players, Goforth, along with Head Football Athletic Trainer Brett Griesemer and Head Football Coach , immediately ordered 110 ProTechs for the upcoming season. "We saw the potential of the ProTech helmet cover from a practical standpoint early on, but once we received the information from Dr. Duma and his staff from the Lab it was a no-brainer to get ProTechs on our football players. With the support from our coaching staff and administration we were able to move quickly to get them ordered from SAFR Sports and get the players equipped," said Griesemer. ProTechs are customizable to any school's helmet color and model. Additionally, they are approved for game play and manufactured in . SAFR Sports President & CEO said, "We applaud initiative to protect their student athletes and are excited to partner with their outstanding football program. The Helmet Lab test results validate our efforts to make football safer." For more information on test results, visit safrsports.com. , Marketing Director SAFR Sports 610.420.0513 SOURCE SAFR Sports

newsArray.title: Snl24.com | Liberia coach promises to make Bafana "suffer"
newsArray.description: Head coach Ansumana Keita has promised that Liberia aim to make Bafana Bafana "suffer" when the two teams meet in the return leg of a Group K African Cup of Nations qualifier.
newsArray.content: The Lone Stars clinched a valuable point after a late equaliser to record a 2-2 draw against Bafana Bafana at Orlando Stadium on Friday. A confident Keita insisted home ground advantage will count for much and believes his chargers will be much sharper than the visitors. | Tuesday's clash will be played at the SKD Sport Complex in Monrovia, in Liberia. This will be the first time since 2020 the country hosts an international fixture, after only having the artificial pitched stadium approved by CAF in February. "For three years now, we have not played at home. The Liberians are hungry, they are hungry. Trust me, before 08:00 in the morning, the stadium will be packed already, trust me. The Liberians will be there to support their team. "To Bafana Bafana, here’s a message for you: We are here to compete. We will compete. "The tactical strategy that we will use to make South Africa suffer, will make them know that, yes, we want to win. We are not going to choke. We’re going to play. No matter what happens, we will play. "South Africa is bigger than us in football, everywhere [in everything] but we are more prepared than them at this time; mentally, physically technically and tactically, we are prepared." The Bafana squad landed in Liberia on Sunday night to put in the final preparations for the clash Kick-off is at 18:00 (SA time). You must be to post and read comments. Click here to register:

newsArray.title: Conte leaves Tottenham after ‘extraordinary’ rant at players
newsArray.description: After another year without a trophy, Spurs are now searching for a new manager
newsArray.content: Antonio Conte’s final match was the 3-3 draw with Southampton on 18 March Tottenham Hotspur FC via Getty Images Antonio Conte’s 16-month spell in charge of Tottenham Hotspur is officially over after he left by “mutual consent” last night. The 53-year-old’s departure comes just over a week after he publicly labelled his players as “selfish” after they threw away a two-goal lead to draw 3-3 against Southampton. The result capped a “miserable” March for Spurs and Conte, said Sky Sports . They were “dumped out” of both the FA Cup and the Champions League to leave them “without a trophy for another season stretching back to 2008”. Over the years Conte has given some “extraordinary” press conferences, said Jason Burt in The Daily Telegraph . But none like the ten-minute rant after that draw on 18 March. He “came out swinging at everyone”, including club chairman Daniel Levy. It was a “declaration of war” for the Italian, who was out of contract at the end of the season. With Spurs sitting fourth in the Premier League table, but out of all cup competitions, the club confirmed the Italian’s exit and also announced that Cristian Stellini will take over as acting head coach for the remainder of the campaign. Stellini will be assisted by Ryan Mason. “We have ten Premier League games remaining and we have a fight on our hands for a Champions League place,” said Levy. “We all need to pull together. Everyone has to step up to ensure the highest possible finish for our club and amazing, loyal supporters.” Exit was a ‘mere formality’ Relations between Conte and the club “deteriorated at all levels”, said James Olley on ESPN . In the “remarkable” post-match news conference, Conte launched a “stinging attack” on the players and the club’s owners, ENIC. “Tottenham’s story is this: 20 years there is this owner and they never won something. Why?” Conte said. “The fault is only for the club, or for every manager that stays here? I have seen the managers that Tottenham had on the bench. You risk to disrupt the figure of the manager and to protect the other situation in every moment.” Skip advert Conte’s exit was a “mere formality” from the moment he concluded his “incendiary unmasking of his squad’s frailties and the culture of failure at the club”, said Phil McNulty on BBC Sport . It put Levy “right in the frontline” for criticism from fans – and that “invariably only ends one way”. Who will take over at Tottenham? While it was clear that Conte had recognised his time at Spurs was more or less done, that doesn’t mean there’s no truth to what he said – he simply told Spurs “a few home truths”, said Martin Samuel in The Times . In recent years, an extraordinary “roll call of managers” has passed through Tottenham – their achievements alone “would command several pages” – but not one has won a “sausage” while at Spurs. That has to say something about the club’s culture and executive management: it “cannot be that all the managers are a poor fit”. In the wake of Conte’s dismissal, and with the club “still battling” for top four, Levy is “reportedly keen to grasp the nettle” and hire a “permanent fix right away”, said Mark White on FourFourTwo . Julian Nagelsmann, who was sacked by Bayern Munich just a few days ago, is “expected for talks shortly”. Nagelsmann, 35, previously managed Hoffenheim and RB Leipzig in the Bundesliga and is the bookies’ favourite to replace Conte, according to Oddschecker . Other names being linked include former Spurs manager Mauricio Pochettino, Eintracht Frankfurt’s Oliver Glasner, Celtic’s Ange Postecoglou, ex-Spain boss Luis Enrique and former Real Madrid head coach Zinedine Zidane. Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share via Email Sport Football Tottenham Antonio Conte Premier League

newsArray.title: Morocco coach in dreamland after win over Brazil
creator: Reuters News Service
newsArray.description: Morocco coach Walid Regragui has hailed his team as history makers after they followed up their giant-killing feats of last year’s World Cup with their first win over Brazil in a friendly in Tangier on Saturday. The Atlas Lions became the first Arab team to defeat the five-times world champions,...
newsArray.content: Morocco coach Walid Regragui has hailed his team as history makers after they followed up their giant-killing feats of last year’s World Cup with their first win over Brazil in a friendly in Tangier on Saturday. The Atlas Lions became the first Arab team to defeat the five-times world champions, with goals from Sofiane Boufal and substitute Abdelhamid Sabiri earning Morocco a 2-1 victory. “It feels like I’m dreaming,” Regragui told reporters. “We wrote history. We beat Brazil, who are number one in the FIFA rankings and the country of football.” The match, Morocco’s first since their stunning run to last year’s World Cup semi-finals, was played out in a festive atmosphere at a sold-out Ibn Batouta stadium in front of more than 65,000 fans. “To make the celebration beautiful, we had to win this match and that’s what we did,” Morocco centre back Romain Saiss said. “We were at the level even though it was complicated. The mental state of the team made the difference and made people happy again and that’s what is important.” Boufal opened the scoring in the 29th minute before Casemiro equalised for Brazil after an error by goalkeeper Yassine Bounou, but substitute Sabiri scored Morocco’s winner with a powerful shot 11 minutes from time. The result was further proof of the strides Morocco have made under Regragui. They became the first Arab team to reach the World Cup quarter-finals last year and the first African team to make the semi-finals, beating Belgium, Spain and Portugal on the way. “All the players fought,” Regragui added. “We weren’t good in the second half, but I liked our fighting spirit. “The defence didn’t back down and we tried to make our fans happy.” They will head into their next match against Peru in Madrid on Tuesday full of confidence. “With this high morale, we’ll try to beat Peru as well, despite the difficulty and lack of time in the month of Ramadan,” Regragui said.

Spain visit Hampden and while they aren’t the same side that dominated Europe and the world with their tiki-taka style. They are still clear favourites to win Group A and the team to beat. New manager Luis De La Fuente got off to a winning start against Norway in Malaga on Saturday night. newsArray.title: Has VAR created more questions than answers? It's your chance to make your feelings clear in our major poll
creator: reporters@dailyrecord.co.uk (Daniel Caw)
newsArray.description: VAR was introduced to the Scottish top-flight at the end of October and it's led to several major talking points.
newsArray.content: VAR has endured a turbulent introduction into Scottish football Group 28 Get the latest news from Record Sport with our daily newsletter Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later. Sign Up No thanks, close We use your sign-up to provide content in the ways you've consented to and improve our understanding of you. This means that we may include adverts from us and third parties based on our knowledge of you. We also may change the frequency you receive our emails from us in order to keep you up to date and give you the best relevant information possible. As always you can unsubscribe at any time. More info Group 28 Thank you for subscribing! We have more newsletters Show Me No thanks, close See our Privacy Notice When VAR was brought in almost six months ago, it was thought that it would help referees get more decisions correct and remove any controversy. However, whilst the introduction of technology has unquestionably modernised the Scottish game, it has not been without its critics and has definitely not eliminated contentious calls. In fact, some of VAR 's biggest snipers would argue its introduction has seen controversial decisions increase in the Premiership – something decision makers would counter argue. Even VAR's most ardent supporter wouldn't have claimed it would be flawless and result in 100 percent of decisions being called correctly, and many of the early issues will be put down to teething problems - as well as the contentious debates over the handball rule. But, with all things considered, how do you think VAR has performed so far? Are Premiership clubs getting bang for their buck? Or should all aspects of video refereeing be completely scrapped from our top-flight? It's your opportunity to let us know how you feel! If the poll doesn't load correctly for you, click HERE . newsArray.content: Ο ΠΑΣΠ ενημέρωσε για τα βραβεία για τα «PASP FOOTBALL AWARDS 2022/23». Αναλυτικά: Όσο πλησιάζουμε προς την ολοκλήρωση του πρωταθλήματος τόσο μεγαλώνει η αγωνία όσον αφορά τους πρωταγωνιστές που θα βραβευτούν στα ετήσια βραβεία του Παγκύπριου Συνδέσμου Ποδοσφαιριστών. Τα «PASP FOOTBALL AWARDS 2022/23», τα οποία έχουν καταστεί θεσμός στα ποδοσφαιρικά δρώμενα της Κύπρου, θα πραγματοποιηθούν τον προσεχή Μάιο και θα μεταδοθούν απευθείας από την Cablenet μέσω του καναλιού Cablenet Sports1HD. Η πρώτη διαδικασία ψηφοφορίας αρχίζει αύριο Τρίτη (28/03/2023) με τη ψηφοφορία για την ανάδειξη του καλύτερου γκολ και καλύτερης απόκρουσης από τη πρώτη φάση του πρωταθλήματος αλλά και του κορυφαίου νέου ποδοσφαιριστή. Ο ΠΑ.Σ.Π. προς ενημέρωση του κοινού ανακοινώνει σήμερα τις κατηγορίες βραβεύσεων και τις λεπτομέρειες σχετικά με τη διαδικασία της ανάδειξης των νικητών: Ο ΠΑ.Σ.Π. θα τιμήσει πρώην ποδοσφαιριστές και ποδοσφαιρίστριες για τη μεγάλη τους προσφορά στο κυπριακό ποδόσφαιρο και την Εθνική ομάδα. Oι 15 τερματοφύλακες που απέσπασαν το Stoiximan Top Save θα τεθούν σε τρεις διαφορετικές ψηφοφορίες: των φιλάθλων στην ιστοσελίδα του ΠΑ.Σ.Π., της ειδικής επιτροπής και των ίδιων των υποψήφιων ποδοσφαιριστών. Θα βραβευτούν οι τρεις κορυφαίες αποκρούσεις της πρώτης φάσης του πρωταθλήματος. Οι βραβεύσεις αφορούν τα τρία καλύτερα γκολ της πρώτης φάσης του πρωταθλήματος. Υποψήφιοι είναι οι 24 νικητές του Stoiximan Top Goal. Οι τρεις νικητές θα ανακηρυχθούν μετά από ψηφοφορία των φιλάθλων στην ιστοσελίδα του ΠΑ.Σ.Π., της ειδικής επιτροπής και των ίδιων των υποψήφιων ποδοσφαιριστών. Τα Χρυσά Γάντια θα λάβουν οι τερματοφύλακες με τα περισσότερα clean sheets σε πρώτο και σε δεύτερο γκρουπ αντίστοιχα. Για το μεγάλο βραβείο Stoiximan Golden Gloves συμπεριλαμβάνονται όλες οι αγωνιστικές της περιόδου. Πρόκειται για τους πρώτους σκόρερ του πρώτου και του δεύτερου γκρουπ στην Α’ Κατηγορία, του Πρωταθλήματος Νέων (U19) και του Γυναικείου Πρωταθλήματος. Θα βραβευτεί η κορυφαία ενδεκάδα όπως θα την επιλέξουν μέσα από εκλογική διαδικασία οι ίδιοι οι ποδοσφαιριστές των ομάδων της Α’ Κατηγορίας. Θα παρουσιαστεί η δεύτερη καλύτερη ενδεκάδα, με τους φιναλίστ ποδοσφαιριστές που έφθασαν ένα βήμα πριν την συμπερίληψή τους στην κορυφαία ενδεκάδα. Ο κορυφαίος προπονητής θα αναδειχθεί από την ψηφοφορία των ιδίων των ποδοσφαιριστών των ομάδων της Α’ Κατηγορίας. Υποψήφιοι για το υπό αναφορά βραβείο είναι οι πρώτοι δέκα ποδοσφαιριστές σε λεπτά συμμετοχής με την ολοκλήρωση της πρώτης φάσης του πρωταθλήματος. Σε αυτή την κατηγορία υπάρχει ηλικιακός περιορισμός. Συγκεκριμένα, οι ποδοσφαιριστές δεν έπρεπε να υπερβαίνουν το 21ο έτος της ηλικίας τους όταν ξεκινούσε η σεζόν. Ο νικητής θα καθοριστεί από τα ακόλουθα κριτήρια: Τις ψήφους των φιλάθλων στην ιστοσελίδα του ΠΑ.Σ.Π., της ειδικής επιτροπής και των ίδιων των υποψήφιων ποδοσφαιριστών. Ο κορυφαίος ποδοσφαιριστής της σεζόν αναδεικνύεται μέσα από την ψηφοφορία των ιδίων των ποδοσφαιριστών των ομάδων της Α’ Κατηγορίας, σε συνάρτηση με τον διεθνή δείκτη InStat index ο οποίος είναι αποτέλεσμα ενός αλγόριθμου με βάση όλες τις ενέργειες που κάνει ο κάθε παίκτης στο γήπεδο.

newsArray.title: Foot-CAN 2023 (Qualifications/4e journée): Le Niger affrontera l’Algérie au stade de Radès
creator: African Manager
newsArray.description: La sélection algérienne de football, arrivée dimanche à Tunis, a effectué la veille une séance d’entraînement nocturne sur la pelouse du stade Hamadi Agrebi de Radès.Les Fennecs, rappelle-t-ton, préparent leur confrontation avec le Niger ce lundi à Radès (17h), dans le cadre de la 4e journée (Groupe F) des éliminatoires de la coupe d’Afrique des […]
newsArray.content: La sélection algérienne de football, arrivée dimanche à Tunis, a effectué la veille une séance d’entraînement nocturne sur la pelouse du stade Hamadi Agrebi de Radès. Les Fennecs, rappelle-t-ton, préparent leur confrontation avec le Niger ce lundi à Radès (17h), dans le cadre de la 4e journée (Groupe F) des éliminatoires de la coupe d’Afrique des nations 2024. Le Niger, contraint de disputer ses matchs en dehors du stade de Niamey, non qualifié par la Confédération africaine de football (CAF) devra accueillir l’Algérie sur le sol tunisien. L’Algérie s’était imposé à l’aller 2-1. A noter que l’accès au stade sera gratuit pour les supporters des deux sélections.

newsArray.title: VIRGINIA TECH TESTS SAFR SPORTS PROTECH HELMET COVER, ORDERS 110 FOR FOOTBALL TEAM
newsArray.description: CHESTER SPRINGS, Pa., March 27, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- This past December, SAFR Sports teamed with Virginia Tech's Helmet Lab to test their latest ProTech helmet cover models on popular 5-Star football helmets. After more than 320 tests conducted over three days of research, the results...
newsArray.content: , /PRNewswire/ -- This past December, SAFR Sports teamed with Helmet Lab to test their latest ProTech helmet cover models on popular 5-Star football helmets. After more than 320 tests conducted over three days of research, the results were impressive – in fact, by adding a SAFR ProTech, the risk of concussion scores were reduced by as much as to 77%. Virgina Tech's Helmet Lab, considered the 'Good Housekeeping Seal of Approval' when it comes to helmet testing, has been providing consumers with unbiased information on helmet safety since 2011. The helmet star rating system is led by Dr. , who revolutionized the field of concussion biomechanics and head injury research. Once Dr. Duma saw the results of SAFR ProTech, he reached out to , Associate Athletic Director for Sports Medicine, and shared SAFR's technology and testing data. Committed to creating the safest environment for their players, Goforth, along with Head Football Athletic Trainer Brett Griesemer and Head Football Coach , immediately ordered 110 ProTechs for the upcoming season. "We saw the potential of the ProTech helmet cover from a practical standpoint early on, but once we received the information from Dr. Duma and his staff from the Lab it was a no-brainer to get ProTechs on our football players. With the support from our coaching staff and administration we were able to move quickly to get them ordered from SAFR Sports and get the players equipped," said Griesemer. ProTechs are customizable to any school's helmet color and model. Additionally, they are approved for game play and manufactured in . SAFR Sports President & CEO said, "We applaud initiative to protect their student athletes and are excited to partner with their outstanding football program. The Helmet Lab test results validate our efforts to make football safer." For more information on test results, visit safrsports.com. , Marketing Director SAFR Sports 610.420.0513 SOURCE SAFR Sports

newsArray.title: Snl24.com | Liberia coach promises to make Bafana "suffer"
newsArray.description: Head coach Ansumana Keita has promised that Liberia aim to make Bafana Bafana "suffer" when the two teams meet in the return leg of a Group K African Cup of Nations qualifier.
newsArray.content: The Lone Stars clinched a valuable point after a late equaliser to record a 2-2 draw against Bafana Bafana at Orlando Stadium on Friday. A confident Keita insisted home ground advantage will count for much and believes his chargers will be much sharper than the visitors. | Tuesday's clash will be played at the SKD Sport Complex in Monrovia, in Liberia. This will be the first time since 2020 the country hosts an international fixture, after only having the artificial pitched stadium approved by CAF in February. "For three years now, we have not played at home. The Liberians are hungry, they are hungry. Trust me, before 08:00 in the morning, the stadium will be packed already, trust me. The Liberians will be there to support their team. "To Bafana Bafana, here’s a message for you: We are here to compete. We will compete. "The tactical strategy that we will use to make South Africa suffer, will make them know that, yes, we want to win. We are not going to choke. We’re going to play. No matter what happens, we will play. "South Africa is bigger than us in football, everywhere [in everything] but we are more prepared than them at this time; mentally, physically technically and tactically, we are prepared." newsArray.title: Conte leaves Tottenham after ‘extraordinary’ rant at players
newsArray.description: After another year without a trophy, Spurs are now searching for a new manager
newsArray.content: Antonio Conte’s final match was the 3-3 draw with Southampton on 18 March Tottenham Hotspur FC via Getty Images Antonio Conte’s 16-month spell in charge of Tottenham Hotspur is officially over after he left by “mutual consent” last night. The 53-year-old’s departure comes just over a week after he publicly labelled his players as “selfish” after they threw away a two-goal lead to draw 3-3 against Southampton. The result capped a “miserable” March for Spurs and Conte, said Sky Sports . They were “dumped out” of both the FA Cup and the Champions League to leave them “without a trophy for another season stretching back to 2008”. Over the years Conte has given some “extraordinary” press conferences, said Jason Burt in The Daily Telegraph . But none like the ten-minute rant after that draw on 18 March. He “came out swinging at everyone”, including club chairman Daniel Levy. It was a “declaration of war” for the Italian, who was out of contract at the end of the season. With Spurs sitting fourth in the Premier League table, but out of all cup competitions, the club confirmed the Italian’s exit and also announced that Cristian Stellini will take over as acting head coach for the remainder of the campaign. Stellini will be assisted by Ryan Mason. “We have ten Premier League games remaining and we have a fight on our hands for a Champions League place,” said Levy. “We all need to pull together. Everyone has to step up to ensure the highest possible finish for our club and amazing, loyal supporters.” Exit was a ‘mere formality’ Relations between Conte and the club “deteriorated at all levels”, said James Olley on ESPN . In the “remarkable” post-match news conference, Conte launched a “stinging attack” on the players and the club’s owners, ENIC. “Tottenham’s story is this: 20 years there is this owner and they never won something. Why?” Conte said. “The fault is only for the club, or for every manager that stays here? I have seen the managers that Tottenham had on the bench. You risk to disrupt the figure of the manager and to protect the other situation in every moment.” Skip advert Conte’s exit was a “mere formality” from the moment he concluded his “incendiary unmasking of his squad’s frailties and the culture of failure at the club”, said Phil McNulty on BBC Sport . It put Levy “right in the frontline” for criticism from fans – and that “invariably only ends one way”. Who will take over at Tottenham? While it was clear that Conte had recognised his time at Spurs was more or less done, that doesn’t mean there’s no truth to what he said – he simply told Spurs “a few home truths”, said Martin Samuel in The Times . In recent years, an extraordinary “roll call of managers” has passed through Tottenham – their achievements alone “would command several pages” – but not one has won a “sausage” while at Spurs. That has to say something about the club’s culture and executive management: it “cannot be that all the managers are a poor fit”. In the wake of Conte’s dismissal, and with the club “still battling” for top four, Levy is “reportedly keen to grasp the nettle” and hire a “permanent fix right away”, said Mark White on FourFourTwo . Julian Nagelsmann, who was sacked by Bayern Munich just a few days ago, is “expected for talks shortly”. Nagelsmann, 35, previously managed Hoffenheim and RB Leipzig in the Bundesliga and is the bookies’ favourite to replace Conte, according to Oddschecker . Other names being linked include former Spurs manager Mauricio Pochettino, Eintracht Frankfurt’s Oliver Glasner, Celtic’s Ange Postecoglou, ex-Spain boss Luis Enrique and former Real Madrid head coach Zinedine Zidane. Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share via Email Sport Football Tottenham Antonio Conte Premier League

newsArray.title: Morocco coach in dreamland after win over Brazil
creator: Reuters News Service
newsArray.description: Morocco coach Walid Regragui has hailed his team as history makers after they followed up their giant-killing feats of last year’s World Cup with their first win over Brazil in a friendly in Tangier on Saturday. The Atlas Lions became the first Arab team to defeat the five-times world champions,...
newsArray.content: Morocco coach Walid Regragui has hailed his team as history makers after they followed up their giant-killing feats of last year’s World Cup with their first win over Brazil in a friendly in Tangier on Saturday. The Atlas Lions became the first Arab team to defeat the five-times world champions, with goals from Sofiane Boufal and substitute Abdelhamid Sabiri earning Morocco a 2-1 victory. “It feels like I’m dreaming,” Regragui told reporters. “We wrote history. We beat Brazil, who are number one in the FIFA rankings and the country of football.” The match, Morocco’s first since their stunning run to last year’s World Cup semi-finals, was played out in a festive atmosphere at a sold-out Ibn Batouta stadium in front of more than 65,000 fans. “To make the celebration beautiful, we had to win this match and that’s what we did,” Morocco centre back Romain Saiss said. “We were at the level even though it was complicated. The mental state of the team made the difference and made people happy again and that’s what is important.” Boufal opened the scoring in the 29th minute before Casemiro equalised for Brazil after an error by goalkeeper Yassine Bounou, but substitute Sabiri scored Morocco’s winner with a powerful shot 11 minutes from time. The result was further proof of the strides Morocco have made under Regragui. They became the first Arab team to reach the World Cup quarter-finals last year and the first African team to make the semi-finals, beating Belgium, Spain and Portugal on the way. “All the players fought,” Regragui added. “We weren’t good in the second half, but I liked our fighting spirit. “The defence didn’t back down and we tried to make our fans happy.” They will head into their next match against Peru in Madrid on Tuesday full of confidence. “With this high morale, we’ll try to beat Peru as well, despite the difficulty and lack of time in the month of Ramadan,” Regragui said.

New manager Luis De La Fuente got off to a winning start against Norway in Malaga on Saturday night. We have more newsletters Show Me No thanks, close See our Privacy Notice When VAR was brought in almost six months ago, it was thought that it would help referees get more decisions correct and remove any controversy. However, whilst the introduction of technology has unquestionably modernised the Scottish game, it has not been without its critics and has definitely not eliminated contentious calls. In fact, some of VAR 's biggest snipers would argue its introduction has seen controversial decisions increase in the Premiership – something decision makers would counter argue. Even VAR's most ardent supporter wouldn't have claimed it would be flawless and result in 100 percent of decisions being called correctly, and many of the early issues will be put down to teething problems - as well as the contentious debates over the handball rule. But, with all things considered, how do you think VAR has performed so far? Are Premiership clubs getting bang for their buck? Or should all aspects of video refereeing be completely scrapped from our top-flight? It's your opportunity to let us know how you feel! If the poll doesn't load correctly for you, click HERE . newsArray.content: Ο ΠΑΣΠ ενημέρωσε για τα βραβεία για τα «PASP FOOTBALL AWARDS 2022/23». Αναλυτικά: Όσο πλησιάζουμε προς την ολοκλήρωση του πρωταθλήματος τόσο μεγαλώνει η αγωνία όσον αφορά τους πρωταγωνιστές που θα βραβευτούν στα ετήσια βραβεία του Παγκύπριου Συνδέσμου Ποδοσφαιριστών. Τα «PASP FOOTBALL AWARDS 2022/23», τα οποία έχουν καταστεί θεσμός στα ποδοσφαιρικά δρώμενα της Κύπρου, θα πραγματοποιηθούν τον προσεχή Μάιο και θα μεταδοθούν απευθείας από την Cablenet μέσω του καναλιού Cablenet Sports1HD. Η πρώτη διαδικασία ψηφοφορίας αρχίζει αύριο Τρίτη (28/03/2023) με τη ψηφοφορία για την ανάδειξη του καλύτερου γκολ και καλύτερης απόκρουσης από τη πρώτη φάση του πρωταθλήματος αλλά και του κορυφαίου νέου ποδοσφαιριστή. Ο ΠΑ.Σ.Π. προς ενημέρωση του κοινού ανακοινώνει σήμερα τις κατηγορίες βραβεύσεων και τις λεπτομέρειες σχετικά με τη διαδικασία της ανάδειξης των νικητών: Ο ΠΑ.Σ.Π. θα τιμήσει πρώην ποδοσφαιριστές και ποδοσφαιρίστριες για τη μεγάλη τους προσφορά στο κυπριακό ποδόσφαιρο και την Εθνική ομάδα. Oι 15 τερματοφύλακες που απέσπασαν το Stoiximan Top Save θα τεθούν σε τρεις διαφορετικές ψηφοφορίες: των φιλάθλων στην ιστοσελίδα του ΠΑ.Σ.Π., της ειδικής επιτροπής και των ίδιων των υποψήφιων ποδοσφαιριστών. Θα βραβευτούν οι τρεις κορυφαίες αποκρούσεις της πρώτης φάσης του πρωταθλήματος. Οι βραβεύσεις αφορούν τα τρία καλύτερα γκολ της πρώτης φάσης του πρωταθλήματος. Υποψήφιοι είναι οι 24 νικητές του Stoiximan Top Goal. Οι τρεις νικητές θα ανακηρυχθούν μετά από ψηφοφορία των φιλάθλων στην ιστοσελίδα του ΠΑ.Σ.Π., της ειδικής επιτροπής και των ίδιων των υποψήφιων ποδοσφαιριστών. Τα Χρυσά Γάντια θα λάβουν οι τερματοφύλακες με τα περισσότερα clean sheets σε πρώτο και σε δεύτερο γκρουπ αντίστοιχα. Για το μεγάλο βραβείο Stoiximan Golden Gloves συμπεριλαμβάνονται όλες οι αγωνιστικές της περιόδου. Πρόκειται για τους πρώτους σκόρερ του πρώτου και του δεύτερου γκρουπ στην Α’ Κατηγορία, του Πρωταθλήματος Νέων (U19) και του Γυναικείου Πρωταθλήματος. Θα βραβευτεί η κορυφαία ενδεκάδα όπως θα την επιλέξουν μέσα από εκλογική διαδικασία οι ίδιοι οι ποδοσφαιριστές των ομάδων της Α’ Κατηγορίας. Θα παρουσιαστεί η δεύτερη καλύτερη ενδεκάδα, με τους φιναλίστ ποδοσφαιριστές που έφθασαν ένα βήμα πριν την συμπερίληψή τους στην κορυφαία ενδεκάδα. Ο κορυφαίος προπονητής θα αναδειχθεί από την ψηφοφορία των ιδίων των ποδοσφαιριστών των ομάδων της Α’ Κατηγορίας. Υποψήφιοι για το υπό αναφορά βραβείο είναι οι πρώτοι δέκα ποδοσφαιριστές σε λεπτά συμμετοχής με την ολοκλήρωση της πρώτης φάσης του πρωταθλήματος. Σε αυτή την κατηγορία υπάρχει ηλικιακός περιορισμός. Συγκεκριμένα, οι ποδοσφαιριστές δεν έπρεπε να υπερβαίνουν το 21ο έτος της ηλικίας τους όταν ξεκινούσε η σεζόν. Ο νικητής θα καθοριστεί από τα ακόλουθα κριτήρια: Τις ψήφους των φιλάθλων στην ιστοσελίδα του ΠΑ.Σ.Π., της ειδικής επιτροπής και των ίδιων των υποψήφιων ποδοσφαιριστών. Ο κορυφαίος ποδοσφαιριστής της σεζόν αναδεικνύεται μέσα από την ψηφοφορία των ιδίων των ποδοσφαιριστών των ομάδων της Α’ Κατηγορίας, σε συνάρτηση με τον διεθνή δείκτη InStat index ο οποίος είναι αποτέλεσμα ενός αλγόριθμου με βάση όλες τις ενέργειες που κάνει ο κάθε παίκτης στο γήπεδο.

newsArray.title: Foot-CAN 2023 (Qualifications/4e journée): Le Niger affrontera l’Algérie au stade de Radès
creator: African Manager
newsArray.description: La sélection algérienne de football, arrivée dimanche à Tunis, a effectué la veille une séance d’entraînement nocturne sur la pelouse du stade Hamadi Agrebi de Radès.Les Fennecs, rappelle-t-ton, préparent leur confrontation avec le Niger ce lundi à Radès (17h), dans le cadre de la 4e journée (Groupe F) des éliminatoires de la coupe d’Afrique des […]
newsArray.content: La sélection algérienne de football, arrivée dimanche à Tunis, a effectué la veille une séance d’entraînement nocturne sur la pelouse du stade Hamadi Agrebi de Radès. Les Fennecs, rappelle-t-ton, préparent leur confrontation avec le Niger ce lundi à Radès (17h), dans le cadre de la 4e journée (Groupe F) des éliminatoires de la coupe d’Afrique des nations 2024. Le Niger, contraint de disputer ses matchs en dehors du stade de Niamey, non qualifié par la Confédération africaine de football (CAF) devra accueillir l’Algérie sur le sol tunisien. L’Algérie s’était imposé à l’aller 2-1. A noter que l’accès au stade sera gratuit pour les supporters des deux sélections.

newsArray.title: VIRGINIA TECH TESTS SAFR SPORTS PROTECH HELMET COVER, ORDERS 110 FOR FOOTBALL TEAM
newsArray.description: CHESTER SPRINGS, Pa., March 27, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- This past December, SAFR Sports teamed with Virginia Tech's Helmet Lab to test their latest ProTech helmet cover models on popular 5-Star football helmets. After more than 320 tests conducted over three days of research, the results...
newsArray.content: , /PRNewswire/ -- This past December, SAFR Sports teamed with Helmet Lab to test their latest ProTech helmet cover models on popular 5-Star football helmets. After more than 320 tests conducted over three days of research, the results were impressive – in fact, by adding a SAFR ProTech, the risk of concussion scores were reduced by as much as to 77%. Virgina Tech's Helmet Lab, considered the 'Good Housekeeping Seal of Approval' when it comes to helmet testing, has been providing consumers with unbiased information on helmet safety since 2011. The helmet star rating system is led by Dr. , who revolutionized the field of concussion biomechanics and head injury research. Once Dr. Duma saw the results of SAFR ProTech, he reached out to , Associate Athletic Director for Sports Medicine, and shared SAFR's technology and testing data. Committed to creating the safest environment for their players, Goforth, along with Head Football Athletic Trainer Brett Griesemer and Head Football Coach , immediately ordered 110 ProTechs for the upcoming season. "We saw the potential of the ProTech helmet cover from a practical standpoint early on, but once we received the information from Dr. Duma and his staff from the Lab it was a no-brainer to get ProTechs on our football players. With the support from our coaching staff and administration we were able to move quickly to get them ordered from SAFR Sports and get the players equipped," said Griesemer. ProTechs are customizable to any school's helmet color and model. Additionally, they are approved for game play and manufactured in . SAFR Sports President & CEO said, "We applaud initiative to protect their student athletes and are excited to partner with their outstanding football program. The Helmet Lab test results validate our efforts to make football safer." For more information on test results, visit safrsports.com. , Marketing Director SAFR Sports 610.420.0513 SOURCE SAFR Sports

newsArray.title: Snl24.com | Liberia coach promises to make Bafana "suffer"
newsArray.description: Head coach Ansumana Keita has promised that Liberia aim to make Bafana Bafana "suffer" when the two teams meet in the return leg of a Group K African Cup of Nations qualifier.
newsArray.content: The Lone Stars clinched a valuable point after a late equaliser to record a 2-2 draw against Bafana Bafana at Orlando Stadium on Friday. A confident Keita insisted home ground advantage will count for much and believes his chargers will be much sharper than the visitors. | Tuesday's clash will be played at the SKD Sport Complex in Monrovia, in Liberia. This will be the first time since 2020 the country hosts an international fixture, after only having the artificial pitched stadium approved by CAF in February. "For three years now, we have not played at home. The Liberians are hungry, they are hungry. Trust me, before 08:00 in the morning, the stadium will be packed already, trust me. The Liberians will be there to support their team. "To Bafana Bafana, here’s a message for you: We are here to compete. We will compete. "The tactical strategy that we will use to make South Africa suffer, will make them know that, yes, we want to win. We are not going to choke. We’re going to play. No matter what happens, we will play. "South Africa is bigger than us in football, everywhere [in everything] but we are more prepared than them at this time; mentally, physically technically and tactically, we are prepared." newsArray.title: Conte leaves Tottenham after ‘extraordinary’ rant at players
newsArray.description: After another year without a trophy, Spurs are now searching for a new manager
newsArray.content: Antonio Conte’s final match was the 3-3 draw with Southampton on 18 March Tottenham Hotspur FC via Getty Images Antonio Conte’s 16-month spell in charge of Tottenham Hotspur is officially over after he left by “mutual consent” last night. The 53-year-old’s departure comes just over a week after he publicly labelled his players as “selfish” after they threw away a two-goal lead to draw 3-3 against Southampton. The result capped a “miserable” March for Spurs and Conte, said Sky Sports . They were “dumped out” of both the FA Cup and the Champions League to leave them “without a trophy for another season stretching back to 2008”. Over the years Conte has given some “extraordinary” press conferences, said Jason Burt in The Daily Telegraph . But none like the ten-minute rant after that draw on 18 March. He “came out swinging at everyone”, including club chairman Daniel Levy. It was a “declaration of war” for the Italian, who was out of contract at the end of the season. With Spurs sitting fourth in the Premier League table, but out of all cup competitions, the club confirmed the Italian’s exit and also announced that Cristian Stellini will take over as acting head coach for the remainder of the campaign. Stellini will be assisted by Ryan Mason. “We have ten Premier League games remaining and we have a fight on our hands for a Champions League place,” said Levy. “We all need to pull together. Everyone has to step up to ensure the highest possible finish for our club and amazing, loyal supporters.” Exit was a ‘mere formality’ Relations between Conte and the club “deteriorated at all levels”, said James Olley on ESPN . In the “remarkable” post-match news conference, Conte launched a “stinging attack” on the players and the club’s owners, ENIC. “Tottenham’s story is this: 20 years there is this owner and they never won something. Why?” Conte said. “The fault is only for the club, or for every manager that stays here? I have seen the managers that Tottenham had on the bench. You risk to disrupt the figure of the manager and to protect the other situation in every moment.” Skip advert Conte’s exit was a “mere formality” from the moment he concluded his “incendiary unmasking of his squad’s frailties and the culture of failure at the club”, said Phil McNulty on BBC Sport . It put Levy “right in the frontline” for criticism from fans – and that “invariably only ends one way”. Who will take over at Tottenham? While it was clear that Conte had recognised his time at Spurs was more or less done, that doesn’t mean there’s no truth to what he said – he simply told Spurs “a few home truths”, said Martin Samuel in The Times . In recent years, an extraordinary “roll call of managers” has passed through Tottenham – their achievements alone “would command several pages” – but not one has won a “sausage” while at Spurs. That has to say something about the club’s culture and executive management: it “cannot be that all the managers are a poor fit”. In the wake of Conte’s dismissal, and with the club “still battling” for top four, Levy is “reportedly keen to grasp the nettle” and hire a “permanent fix right away”, said Mark White on FourFourTwo . Julian Nagelsmann, who was sacked by Bayern Munich just a few days ago, is “expected for talks shortly”. Nagelsmann, 35, previously managed Hoffenheim and RB Leipzig in the Bundesliga and is the bookies’ favourite to replace Conte, according to Oddschecker . Other names being linked include former Spurs manager Mauricio Pochettino, Eintracht Frankfurt’s Oliver Glasner, Celtic’s Ange Postecoglou, ex-Spain boss Luis Enrique and former Real Madrid head coach Zinedine Zidane. Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share via Email Sport Football Tottenham Antonio Conte Premier League

newsArray.title: Morocco coach in dreamland after win over Brazil
creator: Reuters News Service
newsArray.description: Morocco coach Walid Regragui has hailed his team as history makers after they followed up their giant-killing feats of last year’s World Cup with their first win over Brazil in a friendly in Tangier on Saturday. The Atlas Lions became the first Arab team to defeat the five-times world champions,...
newsArray.content: Morocco coach Walid Regragui has hailed his team as history makers after they followed up their giant-killing feats of last year’s World Cup with their first win over Brazil in a friendly in Tangier on Saturday. The Atlas Lions became the first Arab team to defeat the five-times world champions, with goals from Sofiane Boufal and substitute Abdelhamid Sabiri earning Morocco a 2-1 victory. “It feels like I’m dreaming,” Regragui told reporters. “We wrote history. We beat Brazil, who are number one in the FIFA rankings and the country of football.” The match, Morocco’s first since their stunning run to last year’s World Cup semi-finals, was played out in a festive atmosphere at a sold-out Ibn Batouta stadium in front of more than 65,000 fans. “To make the celebration beautiful, we had to win this match and that’s what we did,” Morocco centre back Romain Saiss said. “We were at the level even though it was complicated. The mental state of the team made the difference and made people happy again and that’s what is important.” Boufal opened the scoring in the 29th minute before Casemiro equalised for Brazil after an error by goalkeeper Yassine Bounou, but substitute Sabiri scored Morocco’s winner with a powerful shot 11 minutes from time. The result was further proof of the strides Morocco have made under Regragui. They became the first Arab team to reach the World Cup quarter-finals last year and the first African team to make the semi-finals, beating Belgium, Spain and Portugal on the way. “All the players fought,” Regragui added. “We weren’t good in the second half, but I liked our fighting spirit. “The defence didn’t back down and we tried to make our fans happy.” They will head into their next match against Peru in Madrid on Tuesday full of confidence. “With this high morale, we’ll try to beat Peru as well, despite the difficulty and lack of time in the month of Ramadan,” Regragui said.

Spain visit Hampden and while they aren’t the same side that dominated Europe and the world with their tiki-taka style. They are still clear favourites to win Group A and the team to beat. New manager Luis De La Fuente got off to a winning start against Norway in Malaga on Saturday night. It wasn't quite as comfortable as the 3-0 scoreline suggested after Joselu came off the bench to bag a brace on his debut, and Steve Clarke will take heart from the problems the Norwegians caused the hosts. Scotland took top spot by virtue of alphabetical order after one game played. A positive result in Glasgow on Tuesday would really boost our chances of automatic qualification for Germany next year, although it will be easier said than done against one of the top teams on the continent. newsArray.title: Has VAR created more questions than answers? It's your chance to make your feelings clear in our major poll
creator: reporters@dailyrecord.co.uk (Daniel Caw)
newsArray.description: VAR was introduced to the Scottish top-flight at the end of October and it's led to several major talking points.
newsArray.content: VAR has endured a turbulent introduction into Scottish football Group 28 Get the latest news from Record Sport with our daily newsletter Invalid email Something went wrong, please try again later. We also may change the frequency you receive our emails from us in order to keep you up to date and give you the best relevant information possible. As always you can unsubscribe at any time. More info Group 28 Thank you for subscribing! We have more newsletters Show Me No thanks, close See our Privacy Notice When VAR was brought in almost six months ago, it was thought that it would help referees get more decisions correct and remove any controversy. However, whilst the introduction of technology has unquestionably modernised the Scottish game, it has not been without its critics and has definitely not eliminated contentious calls. In fact, some of VAR 's biggest snipers would argue its introduction has seen controversial decisions increase in the Premiership – something decision makers would counter argue. Even VAR's most ardent supporter wouldn't have claimed it would be flawless and result in 100 percent of decisions being called correctly, and many of the early issues will be put down to teething problems - as well as the contentious debates over the handball rule. But, with all things considered, how do you think VAR has performed so far? Are Premiership clubs getting bang for their buck? Or should all aspects of video refereeing be completely scrapped from our top-flight? It's your opportunity to let us know how you feel! If the poll doesn't load correctly for you, click HERE .
